meanings.definition: A person who is the legal property of another and is forced to obey them.
meanings.sent1: The cruel master treated the slave poorly.
meanings.sent2: The slave worked in the fields from sunrise to sunset.
meanings.sent3: The slave accidentally spilled the water bucket on the master's head.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a slave to her never-ending to-do list.
meanings.sent5: The image of the weary slave carrying heavy chains haunted her dreams.

meanings.definition: A person who is excessively dependent on or controlled by something.
meanings.sent1: He was a slave to his addiction, unable to break free.
meanings.sent2: She was a slave to fashion, always following the latest trends.
meanings.sent3: The cat was a slave to its curiosity, always getting into mischief.
meanings.sent4: The politician was a slave to public opinion, changing his stance with every poll.
meanings.sent5: The child was a slave to his fear of the dark, unable to sleep without a nightlight.

meanings.definition: To work very hard for someone without receiving much in return.
meanings.sent1: She would slave away in the kitchen for hours preparing the feast.
meanings.sent2: He slaved over his homework all night to get it done on time.
meanings.sent3: The robot slaved tirelessly to clean every corner of the house.
meanings.sent4: The artist slaved over the details of the painting, ensuring it was perfect.
meanings.sent5: They slaved in the fields under the scorching sun, their backs aching from the labor.
